reviews.review_msg: nadine roth is a very competent prof. this course is not challenging, but it is a very good grounding in 20th century european history.
Awesome Prof... knows her stuff, fair marking... just read sourcebook, you'll be good to go.

Very interesting material. But beware that her testing format makes the material a lot harder than it should be. You have to study all the sourcebook stories which is a chore. Only had 45 mins to complete midterm.

Nadine is WONDERFUL... repeating what has been said: not easiest, but really fair and willing to help and talk to you.  Great prof, knowledgeable, and wonderful lectures prepared weekly.  I'd give anything to take her class again!
Awesome teacher.  Best in the department.  Not the easiest but fair.
Very knowledgeable and interested in the material.  Great powerpoint used in lectures.  I recommend taking a class with her if you can.
good lecture and good tutorials.  too bad her upper division classes were full
Excellent lecturer... always makes class interesting.
Very good lecturer...
No Comments
I looked up Professor Garfinkel on the History department website and he wasn't there. I saw that he's now in Global Humanities. I look forward to taking more courses with him there. Great prof.

I struggled in this class but that wasn't Garfinkel's fault. Really passionate about what he's teaching and his lectures are clear and easy to understand, if a little dense. PSAs are especially tough for any non-history student--work with your TAs and get to know what they want! Do your research before taking this class--it is NOT a GPA booster.
This prof is the best in the department. Organized lectures, great humour, excellent feedback on papers and helpful  in office hours.  I will definitely take again.

I've had Garfinkel for two courses, I find that he is extremely clear in his lectures and organized. His assignments are straightforward, there isn't any homework or papers, and he's always available for extra help. A bit long-winded but he definitely is passionate about History. Would recommend.

Professor Garfinkel was a great professor! His lectures were exceptionally organized and interesting. He is very clear on his expectations for PSAs & exams, and gives detailed information on how to do well in the class. If you attend lectures and write down his lecture slides, you will do well. Textbook wasn't needed for passing, just for clarity.
Lectures were too fast
despite the fact that his lectures are really organized, it is hard to keep up with him bc he talks so damn fast.  takin notes as he speaks is impossible. decent content though

Paul is easily the best professor I have ever had. His lectures are fantastic, not only because he's hilarious, but because they're SO organized! With each lecture, he outlines what questions he'll be addressing, so you know exactly what's going on and what to expect. I wish I were a history student so I could take more of his classes. 1010!

Garfinkel is a prof that teaches you to think and analyze. The course is interesting; however reading is 40+ pages per week. The exams cover 12 chapters/lectures but there are only 5 questions to answer. 2 id questions 2 short answer and 1 primary source analysis. His lecture slides are the bare minimum and you have to pay attention to everything

I found his course thoroughly enjoyable. Contrary to the post below mine, I thought his exams were fair, and the final wasn't cumulative. Everything from week 8 to week 13 was on the exam; most other history courses work the same way. The professor's lectures were informative as long as you wrote everything he said and ignored the slides.

Is not clear on the exam prep. You have to prep for 50 years of european history for each exam, and its just too much. This class has no papers, just exams, which is not to your advantage. The final is 50%.

Garfinkel flat out rules. He's everything you want in a prof. -- fair, approachable, his demands are very reasonable, & his lectures & tutorials are clear & engaging & often amusing. Exams were very fair. He's only a hard marker if you're not a hard worker. A good mark is not hard to get if you work a little. I'll def. take another class with him.

A VERY HARD COURSE! One of the texts was incredibly difficult to read due to the dull nature of the book, a massive amount of reading and his lectures weren't all that great. He does give you chances to get your mark up there, though you still have to work your ass off to get a decent mark. I have no idea how I survived his class.
Lectures are dull and uninteresting. He is an extremely hard marker. Half the textbooks are irrelevant to the course material.

One of the hardest and worst professors I've ever had, but one of the nicest guys. I learned nothing from his lectures and struggled considerably in this class despite my interest in the course material. However, he's an understanding guy in tought circumstances. Don't take this class unless you like boring lectures and working like an ox.

Prof Garfinkle taught a fair class and if you were willing to work for your grade then it was obtaainable. He was completley fair about the midterm and final and we knew what to expect. His marking of the essay papers was a bit brutal but other then that he was  agreat teacher and i would recommend

Can't say enough good things about Professor Garfinkel! I loved this class even though the final makes me a little nervous. But he did give us the two essay questions in advance and has arranged review sessions. As usual he's very fair and helpful and does want students to do well.

simply terrific. great lecturing style (clear, to the point, good slides, funny), totally fair marker. i thought i bombed the midterm but ended up doing well. hard but manageable, but you better like to read. and he's kinda cute in a professorial sorta way:)
Amazing

Jeremy is an amazing professor! I had him in Spring 2021 for Chinese History and he was absolutely hilarious. He makes lectures really entertaining with his own personal swing on it. If you need to take a history course, he is the professor to look for!!! 10/10!

This class is pretty interesting and I honestly don't mind the weekly journals, but it would be nice if the readings were organized more thoughtfully. Some weeks you're assigned to read less than 5 pages, other weeks be prepared to read 150+ pages.

This was BY FAR the single best university course I have ever taken.  Professor Brown is profoundly knowledgeable, passionate and  approachable. I strongly recommend attending his office hours and discussing the lectures. His lectures are incredibly organized - you will NOT have time to play games/text in class. You MUST take lots of notes.
Awesome teacher, just dont be late or miss any classes.

Fun and Easy going Prof, encourages questions and comments. Tutorials are informative and entertaining. Some of the Tutorials have lame-esque group exercises, but still no problem. I like how she handles Essay's, great topics with choice I Recommend her for sure. I'm gonna take her HIST 235 class this summer.

While the material was presented in a very engaging and energetic fashion, some of her requirements for the essays/assignments were confusing and at times, contradictory. Up until the final exam, I still wasn't sure what she was looking for. She's a good professor, but I would show hesitation when enrolling in another class with her.
Caring and passionate. Tutorial readings and discussion are very engaging.

Was really lookin forward to the class but it was not what I expected. She jumps around a lot and tends to focus intently on certain things while ignoring some of the big issues. Paper assignment was fair though it was difficult to achieve a good grade (TA marked it though)and tutorial quizzes were easy, but take home midterm and final were brutal!

I really loved having her as a professor.  She broke up a 2 hour lecture well by using pictures and clips.  The tutorials were awesome as it was mainly a Q&A about the material.  She was extremely helpful and made it fun.  It's an easy class for those people who like history.

She's a good prof who tries to cover everything in detail.  Her essay assignments are fair but the questions are both broad and specific at the same time.  Lectures were interesting enough but shows a lot of clips (if that's not your thing).
Really interesting class, very nice and approachable. Uses lots of papers for assignments but they are short and fair. Lots of readings though from textbook and online. Good prof overall.

this is the hardest marking professor i have ever had.  he is very rigid in his delivery, and only allows things done one way.  he had a 15 minute quiz worth 5% of the entire class grade based on a 350 page book.  i would never take a class from this prof again.
Horrible professor.  Would cancel class to do research for his next book.  Would only use his text in class - money grab.  Knew material but didn't know how to teach.
Kept cancelling classes to travel to Europe.  Very arrogant.  Stay away if you can.
Amazing, best professor I have ever had. He is intelligence and writes amazing works of history.Wish we had more like him.....
He is the best professor I have ever had!

Whoa guys, cool it! I had him a while ago, maybe he's gotten old, but I don't remember him as bad at all. Actually reminded me of Indiana Jones's English sidesick going off on int'l expeditions on the weekends. Seemed knowledgeable enough
No Comments
No Comments
A major disappointment.  Totaly unhelpful and out of touch.

I am very big into history, but I don't like the way he teaches the class. If the exam answers aren't exactly the way he wants them, you will get a bad grade. During his lectures, you really have to pay attention because the lecture slides are very bland and don't show a lot of information. He just explains it all. Prepare to take a lot of notes!!!

Not the class for you if you struggle to write tests as there's no term paper or assignment to balance the grade. My only critique is that you must attend every lecture to be up to date. I missed one week where the tutorial was cancelled (announced in class) and no announcement was sent via Canvas to let others know ;-; Ilya is a great prof!

While Ilya's lectures can sometimes go into random tangents, he is a super great guy! He is always so happy and he is extremely passionate about his subject. Although it is reading-intensive, it is a very basic 2nd year history course. I really enjoyed Ilya!

I am not a history major and took this class as an elective. The lectures are not bad but, you must attend as you will miss out on important information. Also, participating in tutorial makes a big difference in your mark. I think this is a good class to take as an elective as it is quite interesting. It spans from WWI to the fall of communism.
Engaging lectures can see/feel his interest in the subject during lectures. assigns a lot of readings, but if you take good enough notes you can just skim through the readings. Would take again.

Prof.V is decent. His lectures can be a bit all over the place, but try your best to take good notes, because his tests mostly focus on lecture material instead of textbook (discala) material. You can actually do without the textbook entirely, just make sure that you read the 2 novels! They're important on the tests. Overall, solid, passionate guy

Great prof, very knowledgable and interested in the subject. Definitely read the textbook because his lectures will jump all over the place and can be confusing and hard to follow. Vinkovetsky has a good sense of humour if you listen to him, and will tell funny history jokes. Beware of difficult marking on midterms. Tutorials are fun though!

Overall, I think he's a good prof. Sometimes he seems to get flustered over his words and stutters through sentences, but the meaning is never lost. I found the material very interesting. Di Scala textbook is easy to read but it's huge, and we read all of it. A lot of other reading too. The tests are straightforward, but my TA was a tough grader
A very brilliant and energetic prof.  A bit scatterbrained maybe and his jokes seem to go over the head of most people in this entry level course..

Very insightful and enthusiastic professor. And he is approachable and great for conversation outside of class. The tests were challenging but not impossible. Lots on eastern Europe. Come prepared to lecture, and you will learn a lot.

No organization and no visual aids in lecture. He stands infront of the class and speaks for an hour in a random manner. The lack of power point, or projector slides caused a severe lack of focus in his lecture! Hard to take notes

Great prof! The class itself is hard because of the overwhelming amount of reading and memorizing. But the prof is such an nice guy that if you show ur effort, he knows it and gives credits for it. I screwed my first test but excelled in the second one. He threw my first test mark away and only counted the second one. Work hard and u'll be fine!
